member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamCameraOpen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Open a camera.
member.remarks: For LucamExternalInterface.USB2, it forces a reenumeration. So, in that case, it isn't possible to reliably open a specific camera by index. Instead, use LucamExternalInterface.USB3 which will also enumerate USB2 devices.
member.param: The camera number. This is a number from 1 to the number of connected cameras.
member.returns: Camera handle to be used in subsequent API calls that perform operations on this specific camera. Note that the handle value may be reused after this camera is closed and another camera is opened.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamEnumCameras(Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamVersion[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Enumerate the list of connected cameras.
member.remarks: Returns the device enumeration determined by (). If LucamNumCameras() hasn't been called, it will be called internally.
member.param: An array of structures, one for each connected camera. The caller must allocate the array of sufficient dimensions to accommodate the number of connected cameras. This means in practice that the caller must determine the number of cameras first.
The number of entries available in 'v'.
member.returns: The number of connected cameras.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamGetLastError
member.summary: Query the error code for the last API error (not camera specific - for camera specific error, see ().
member.returns: The error code.
member.seealso: Camera specific error function - important if your application connects to more than one camera at a time.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamNumCameras
member.summary: Query the number of connected cameras.
member.returns: The number of cameras.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamSelectExternInterface(Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamExternalInterface)
member.summary: Select which physical interface API will operate on.
member.remarks: USB1, USB2 and USB3 all enumerate all version of USB devices.
member.returns: False if there is an error.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddRgbPreviewCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamRgbPreviewCallback,System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPixelFormat)
member.summary: Register an RGB frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera. If called after the stream is started the pixel format must match LucamQueryRgbPreviewPixelFormat(). If called before then it can be any format that is valid for the current pixel depth of the camera. If the requested pixel format is not the default value there may be a data copy (minor performance cost). Note that the image buffer is upside down and that the color values are in BGR order. LucamRgbPreviewCallbacks may be either PF_24 or PF_32. Programs must be prepared to handle either format.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddSnapshotCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamStreamingCallback,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Register a raw snapshot frame event callback.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveSnapshotCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamAddStreamingCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamStreamingCallback,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Register a raw stream video frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.GetTruePixelDepth(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the actual image pixel depth (number of significant bits) for the specified camera handle. Note that the pixel depth is for the current preview PixelFormat (see GetFormat(), GetPixelFormat()). Note that the pixel depth in 8-bit mode is always 8. The main purpose of this function is to get the true pixel depth of 16-bit data. Snapshot (Stills, FastFrames) have the same pixel depth as preview mode but there is no way to query the snapshot pixel depth directly. Instead, set the preview PixelFormat appropriately and then call GetTruPixelDepth().
member.returns: The number of significant bits for the camera image data.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.GetTruePixelDepthTo8(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the ratio to convert 16-bit values to 8-bit values. To support integer math the value is the number of 16-bit DN represented by each 8-bit DN. Divide 16-bit values by this number to get 8-bit values.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.GetPixelFormatBitsPerPixel(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determine the number of storage bits per pixel for the current preview PixelFormat (see GetFormat(), GetPixelFormat()).
member.returns: The number of bits per pixel.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.GetPixelFormatBytesPerPixel(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determine the number of storage bits per pixel for the current preview PixelFormat (see GetFormat(), GetPixelFormat()).
member.returns: The number of bytes per pixel.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.GetPixelFormatImageSize(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the size of each image in bytes for the current ROI and PixelFormat (see GetFormat(), GetPixelFormat(), GetRoi()).
member.returns: The number of bytes per image.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.GetPixelFormatLsb(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the bit position of the least significant bit of raw image data for the current PixelFormat (see GetFormat(), GetPixelFormat()).
member.returns: The bit position of the least significant bit of raw image data.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.GetPixelFormatMsb(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the bit position of the most significant bit of raw image data for the current PixelFormat (see GetFormat(), GetPixelFormat()).
member.returns: The bit position of the most significant bit of raw image data.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.SetCheckProperty(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamProperty,System.IConvertible,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPropertyFlag,System.Double)
member.summary: Set a property value in the camera. Properties in the camera may be constrained or have limited granularity. This function reads back the actual property value and compares it to the target value. An exception is thrown if the actual value is not within a specified percentage of the target value.
member.param: Percentage tolerance (ignore property value for non discrete properties when negative- i.e. non integer/enum properties).
member.returns: Actual property value.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.SetCheckProperty(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamProperty,System.IConvertible,System.Double)
member.summary: Set a property value in the camera. Properties in the camera may be constrained or have limited granularity. This function reads back the actual property value and compares it to the target value. An exception is thrown if the actual value is not within a specified percentage of the target value.
member.param: Percentage tolerance (ignore property value for non discrete properties when negative- i.e. non integer/enum properties).
member.returns: Actual property value.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.SetCheckPropertyAndFlags(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamProperty,System.IConvertible,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPropertyFlag,System.Double)
member.summary: Set a property value in the camera. Properties in the camera may be constrained or have limited granularity. This function reads back the actual property value and compares it to the target value. An exception is thrown if the actual value is not within a specified percentage of the target value. This function reads back the flags and compares them to the target value. An exception is thrown if the actual value is not the same as the target. Don't use with AUTO because the property value may change as a result of the AUTO function.
member.param: Percentage tolerance (ignore property value for non discrete properties when negative- i.e. non integer/enum properties).
member.returns: Actual property value.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.AddRgbPreviewCallback(System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamRgbPreviewCallback,System.IntPtr,Lumenera.USB.dll.LucamPixelFormat)
member.summary: Register an RGB frame event callback. The callback will be called for each frame received from the camera. If called after the stream is started the pixel format must match LucamQueryRgbPreviewPixelFormat(). If called before then it can be any format that is valid for the current pixel depth of the camera. If the requested pixel format is not the default value there may be a data copy (minor performance cost). Note that the image buffer is upside down and that the color values are in BGR order.
member.param: Unique identifier passed to the callback function.
member.returns: Callback ID (for later removal of the callback - see LucamRemoveRgbPreviewCallback()). On error returns -1.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.RemoveRgbPreviewCallback(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)

member.summary: Put the camera in snapshot mode. Applies the LucamSnapshot settings and clocks the imaging sensor waiting for a snapshot trigger. Note that some properties can be changed after EnableFastFrames() - e.g. STILL_EXPOSURE, STILL_GAIN, BLACK_LEVEL. member.returns: synchronous snapshot handle (for use with TakySyncSnapshots).

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.TakeSynchronousSnapshots(System.Int32,System.Byte[][])
member.summary: Take synchronous snapshots.
member.param: Array of raw image buffers for the snapshot images. These buffers must correspond in size to the LucamFrameFormat for that camera. The byte[][] type is a sparse array (an array of arrays) which requires that each of the first dimension (leftmost index) be initialized with a byte array (e.g. new byte[imageSize]). This approach allows the buffers to vary in size according to the camera type and settings in use for each camera.

member.name: M:Lumenera.USB.api.DisableSynchronousSnapshots(System.Int32)
member.summary: Release the synchronous snapshot handle.

member.name: P:Lumenera.DebugLog.Contexts
